law.catch_line: A person may intervene in a civil action brought by the Commission under this part, if the action in...

text.section:
A person may intervene in a civil action brought by the Commission under this part, if the action involves:
an alleged discriminatory act to which the person is a party; or
a conciliation agreement to which the person is a party.

The Commission may intervene in a civil action brought under this part, if:
the Commission certifies that the case is of general public importance; and
timely application is made.
The court may grant any appropriate relief to an intervening party that may be granted to a plaintiff in a civil action under § 20-1013 of this subtitle.
